titleStmt.title: A discourse occasioned vpon the late defeat, giuen to the arch-rebels, Tyrone and Odonnell, by the right Honourable the Lord Mountioy, Lord Deputie of Ireland, the 24. of December, 1601. being Christmas Eaue and the yeelding vp of Kinsale shortly after by Don Iohn to his Lordshippe: by Raph Byrchensha Esquire, Controller Generall of the musters in Ireland. Seene and allowed.
titleStmt.author: Byrchensha, Raph.

titleStmt.title: A discourse occasioned vpon the late defeat, giuen to the arch-rebels, Tyrone and Odonnell, by the right Honourable the Lord Mountioy, Lord Deputie of Ireland, the 24. of December, 1601. being Christmas Eaue and the yeelding vp of Kinsale shortly after by Don Iohn to his Lordshippe: by Raph Byrchensha Esquire, Controller Generall of the musters in Ireland. Seene and allowed.
titleStmt.author: Byrchensha, Raph.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by R. Bradock] for M[atthew] L[ownes] and are to be sould in Saint Dunstans Church-yarde.,

notesStmt.note: Printer's and publisher's names from STC.
Running title reads: A discourse vpon the defeate of the rebels in Ireland.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
